fields.summary: Support for Oracle 12c

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce:

# Edit a  page
# Before saving the page put the following characters into the "What Did You Change" fields: {code}`~!@#$%^&*()_-+=|\}]{["':;?/>.<,{code}
!changecomment.png|thumbnail!
# Save the page
# Wait for a minute
# Access your dashboard

h3. Expected Results:

Confluence "Recently-Updated-Dashboard" macro should display the whole character without stripping certain special characters from it.

h3. Actual Results:

Confluence "Recently-Updated-Dashboard" macro stripped the following characters:

* ~
* ^
* *
* -
* _
* +
* |
* '[' and ']'

!result.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Certain Special Character In The Change Comment are Stripped In The Recently-Updated-Dashboard Macro

fields.description:
There is a text file in the attachment, which when opened with a regular text editor like notepad, having the text copied to the clipboard, then from there into Confluence editor, will freeze Chrome tab.

The same issue is not reproducible in other browsers.

Please note, that the issue is not reproducible if you open the file directly in the browser and copy from there.
fields.summary: Pasting a certain string into the editor will freeze Chrome tab

fields.description: I have completed to update the confluence. And then I cannot send the email and share the page on the confluence. I'm using the sendmail and mysql.

fields.description:
As of Confluence 5.2.3, since the quicknav search is using the rest API for quicknav searches, unauthenticated users are unable to search. Quicknav search worked as expected as of 5.1.4, but in our upgrade to 5.2.3 it broke this for unauthorized users. In 5.2.3, requests to rest/quicknav/1/search?query=QUERY receive a '401 Unauthorized' response, with the body '{"message":"Client must be authenticated to access this resource.","status-code":401}'. The full search page does work for anonymous users, but not the quicknav autocomplete functionality.

No settings or anything were changed on our end between 5.1.4 (quicknav search working) and the upgrade to 5.2.3 (quicknav serch broken).

As a workaround, I locally patched the Confluence-Quicknav bundled plugin, using the Confluence Rest plugin as a reference. In the {{QuickNavResource.java}} file ({{com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.quicknav.resources}} package) I imported {{com.atlassian.plugins.rest.common.security.AnonymousAllowed}} and added {{@AnonymousAllowed}}. After rebuilding, anonymous users were able to search. However, I am unaware of whether there are any ramifications of this.

EDIT:
I'll note we're using the EAR/WAR release, and auth is done using the Confluence HTTP Authenticator (https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/shibauth.confluence.authentication.shibboleth).
fields.summary: Anonymous Search Errors

we are currently evalutation confluence und have installed it in a tomcat container. Because our smtp server uses smtps we have configured it via jndi.

But when we try to send a test mail the system throws an exception:

    mail.smtp.auth="true" mail.transport.protocol="smtps"

When you Share a page with a Group, the UI indicates that the share was successful, a green (/) Sent icon is shown, but the emails are not actually sent.

On the logs you can see the following stack trace:

fields.summary: Share by Group is suggesting it was successful but it doesn't actually work

fields.description:
After making a change in a confluence page that as non ascii characters in the page title (eg: é), the "view change" link goes to a page with the following message : 
"The following error(s) occurred:

    Could not find the specified page versions
"

After a quick look, it seems that the link targets selectedPageVersions=n+1  and selectedPageVersions=n, while the latest version of the page is n.
fields.summary: Dashboard "view change" link is broken for pages with modified history

fields.description:
h4. Steps to Reproduce # Create a user with a valid email # Click "Reset Password" # Enter the email # View the email in IE8 h4. Expected Results The "Reset Password" button in the email should be shown and clickable h4. Actual Results The "Reset Password" button in the email is not shown and clickable. This issue occurs in Lotus Notes and Live Mail. The same email viewed in Gmail does not have such issue. But when exporting Gmail into html, this button is not shown. !live mail.png|width=50%! h4. Findings The customer found out that the button is also not shown and not clickable when viewed in IE8. Try to view this HTML on IE8 and it won't show anything: {code:html} test
Reset password
{code} h4. Workaround Please have a look at [this comment|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-30587?focusedCommentId=534139&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-534139]
fields.summary: "Reset Password" button in Forgot Your Password emails is not shown for some email clients in IE8

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-30586].
  {panel}

Specific GIFS are not working properly in Confluence 5.1.x versions. In this case, when you try to re-size the GIF to the smallest size (thumbnail) it's not displayed in all browsers. I have attached the gif file in order to reproduce it.

h4.Steps to Reproduce

# Create a page
# Edit the Page
# Insert > Image (or Drag&Drop the GIF file)
# Re-size the image to the smallest size option:
!gifscreenshot.png!
# The image thumbnail is not displayed properly

PS: If you try to open the same GIF in a new tab, Confluence will display an 'java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException'
fields.summary: Animated GIFS can't be resized in Confluence
Page Tree should remember its state across page visits

fields.description:
The German translation is not consistent, so one thinks the menü addresse two different functions.

*In English:*
Watch 
Manage Watchers

*In German:*
Überwachen (means Observe)
Beobachter verwalten (means Manager Watchers)

So users may ask: what is the difference between watching a page and observing a page.

Translation should be "Beobachten"
_or_
Überwachen
Überwacher verwalten
fields.summary: German translation inconsistent for 'watchers'
Enabling Admin to manage Site Homepage of users and groups

fields.description:
This issue occurs for instances with a very large set of users (seen in a [25,000 user instance|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110984/constant-cpu-and-database-activity-caused-by-the-confluence-daily-summary-email-plugin]-130,000 users) and had also been seen in instances with smaller set of users (1700-2000).

Currently, the only known workaround is to disable the plugin. To do so, go to: *Confluence Admin > Manage Add-ons > All Add-ons* and search for 'daily summary'
fields.summary: The daily summary email plugin causes high CPU usage

When adding a comment with a PDF Macro, the PDF will never render. The PDF does render normally on the same page.

fields.description:
I've attached an [XML backup which demonstrates the problem|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/100175/TES-130709-4.xml.zip].

*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Create a page with a slash in the title 
# Attach a file to this page, such as a PDF
# Create a child page, and attempt to embed the attachment from the parent page with the viewfile macro

*Results:*
Instead of rendering the PDF, Confluence displays:

{code}Error rendering macro 'viewppt' : The viewfile macro is unable to locate the attachment "Test.ppt" on this page{code}

The Page Name field of the viewfile macro also displays:
{{/ test///}}
Instead of:
{{pdf / test}}

Here's a screenshot from a customer effected by this explaining the problem: 

!viewppt-error-symptom.jpg|width=100%!
fields.summary: Referencing an attachment from a page with a slash in its title causes the viewfile macro to fail

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-30578].
  {panel}

After this week's Confluence OnDemand release, we have seen a number of instances that started up without critical plugins, such as:
* Confluence Create Content Plugin
* Confluence Software Blueprints Bundle Plugin

Confluence happily loads without giving any errors (save for some stack traces in the logs, which customers cannot see). Confluence will then have critical functionality missing, such as the "Create" button not being present.

What should happen is that Confluence should start in an 'error' state and have its pages return 500 errors so that our monitoring can detect the problem and we can do something about it, instead of relying on customer reports.
fields.summary: Confluence doesn't alert when it starts up without critical plugins

fields.description:
When you try to open a mobile link of a page in a Computer with IE 8 or 9, it simply doesn't render the page, just a blue box in the header instead.

Firefox and Chrome open the link without issues.

Steps to reproduce:
1) using a mobile device, view any Confluence page
2) copy the URL and send it to a desktop user
3) using IE8 or 9 with compatibility mode disabled, try to open that mobile URL
4) the page will show up blank with a blue header (see attached screenshot)
fields.summary: Mobile links don't open on Internet Explorer

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-30576].
  {panel}

As a Product Owner,
I want to see the _Summary_ of a Jira issue that has been inserted via "Insert JIRA Issue" while still in Edit mode,
So that I can organize multiple issues in my roadmap.

AC:
A. At least, ID and Summary are both shown in Edit mode.

Notes:
* Currently, only issue ID is shown.  Now would also like Summary.
* Summary is currently shown in View mode, but not Edit mode.
fields.summary: Insert JIRA Issue - Show issue Summary while in Edit mode

fields.description:
The {{confluence-space-ia}} plugin, new in Confluence 5.x, is not currently included in the Confluence source distribution.

Customers would like to be able to access the source code to this plugin in order to customize it and/or learn how to replicate certain aspects of its behaviour.

This will be a general problem for new plugins. We need to solve this in a generic way, or identify missing plugins automatically.
fields.summary: The confluence-space-ia plugin is missing from the Confluence source distribution

fields.description:
*STEPS TO REPRO*
- create a page
- insert the TOC in the page
- paste some long text and within it create a couple of headings (for instance: heading 2 or heading 3)
- in the text of the heading, put some text which contains a single quote, for instance:

{quote}
some text bla bla
(Heading 2) Casi d'uso
some other text bla bla
(Heading 3) Limiti dell'ambito
some more text bla bla
{quote}

- save the page, look at the TOC and try to click to one of the headings with the single quote character to jump to the corresponding paragraph

*EXPECTED BEHAVIOUR*
The page jumps to the correct paragraph, just like when clicking on an heading with no single quote in it.

*ACTUAL BEHAVIOUR*
Clicking on the heading in the TOC does nothing.
fields.summary: Using a single quote on a heading causes the link in the TOC to not work

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-30567].
{panel}
Allow for access to common variables for use in Blueprints templates through the template editor, eg:
 # Current date
 # Current time
 # Author
 # User
 # System baseUrl

Eg this could be used to create a Blueprint which creates pages with Title:
 2013-08-27: <user>'s Notes
{panel:title=Atlassian status as of November 16, 2018|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
Hi all,

Thanks for your interest in this issue.

Unfortunately, this suggestion isn't currently on our roadmap - we’re instead focusing on bringing you a new search experience, and are investigating improvements to permissions.

We do though understand the value that common variables in Blueprints would bring - we'll typically review this request at least once a year, at which point we’ll consider whether we need to alter its status. 

There is an add-on available in our Marketplace which provides a solution to this problem - [Blueprint Creator|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1218917/blueprint-creator-advanced-templates?hosting=server&tab=overview]. I’m aware this isn’t optimal, but wanted to draw your attention to the workaround nonetheless.

I apologise for the disappointment and will ensure we provide you with an update on this feature request within the next 12 months.

Best
 Jenny Millman | Product Manager - Confluence Server
{panel}
fields.summary: Allow for access to common variables in Blueprints templates

fields.description:
How to reproduce

Take 2 lines of raw text, for example:
Line 1
Line 2

*    Create a new page
*    Within the page press the button for a bullet list
*    Copy and paste the two lines of text into it.
 *       The editor inserts it as two paragraphs, after looking at it in the source code editor, which may be the intended function.
 *   Go to line 2 and press backspace and then return
        This adds the second line to the bullet list as line 1 is.
 *   Now go to the bottom of the page (ctrl-End) and press return until you get to a paragraph line that is not in the bullet list.
  *  Repeat the steps above (2-4)
        At this point you have two bullet lists containing 2 lines.
    Indent the 3rd line (Line 1 in the second list) and then hit backspace
        You will notice that it moves the 3rd line up, but leaves the bullet where it was.
will be multiple levels of bullets all within the same line, along with others.
fields.summary: Pasting text with newlines into bullet lists causes problems

fields.description:
When an upload of a file, started from the attachments macro, fails, the response is nevertheless "success".

The attachment macro of the confluence-attachments-plugin tries to read the response message from the upload action but could not find the element with the class "errorBox". The error is contained in a different element div.aui-message.error. This leads to a "successful" upload, wether the upload was correct or not.
fields.summary: Wrong response from broken file upload in attachments macro

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce:

# Create a new template
# Insert "Text" type variable into it
# Save
# Create a new page from the newly created template
# Insert complete URL (example: https://jira.atlassian.com) into the text variable field
# Click next

h3. Expected and Actual Results:

Confluence should automatically convert the inputted URL into a link, instead it doesn't acknowledge the input as a link and keep it as a normal string.

h3. Workaround:

Pressing a "space" or "enter" button at the end of the URL string will convert it into a link.
fields.summary: Text Variables Field in Template does not Convert URL Automatically

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-30547].
  {panel}

Setting the Jira macro display columns to "Priority,Key,Summary,Assignee,Description,Due" produces a display which is blank on all columns except the *key*.

Replacing with "priority,key,summary,assignee,description,due" restores the display.

This is a problem that appeared with an upgrade.  The macro worked in 3.X with capitalizations but has produced a lot of bad pages in v5.1.   Ability to enter capitals allows them to be copied from actual Jira pages where they are capitalized.  

Friendlier behaviour would be to either always allow caps or to lowercase the column list when the macro data is saved...
fields.summary: JIRA macro fails on title case column names

fields.description:
h4. Steps to Reproduce
Here's the code snippets used to test this bug:
{code:java}
            String content = readFile("C:/Users/Amalia/Desktop/temp/StorageFormatFile-fails.xml");
            
            // create a new page
            RemotePage page = new RemotePage();
            page.setSpace("TEST");
            page.setTitle("Remote Test 4");
            page.setParentId(10256385);
            page.setContent(content);
            
            // store it
            page = service.storePage(token, page);
            System.out.println("Content created");
            
            // change the page content
            page.setContent(content);
            
            //define the update options
            RemotePageUpdateOptions opt = new RemotePageUpdateOptions();
            opt.setVersionComment("new update");
            opt.setMinorEdit(true);
            
            // make some changes
            RemotePage updated = new RemotePage();
            updated = service.updatePage(token, page, opt);

            System.out.println("Content updated");
 
            System.out.println("content: " + updated.getContent()
            		+ "version: " + updated.getVersion()
            		);{code}

What the code does:
# Read [^StorageFormatFile-fails.xml] file, which contains XML and DOCTYPE declaration
# Use {{storePage()}} method to create a new page. The content of the page is the storage format in Step 1 above
# Once the page is stored, we update the page. This time, we use the same content, but using {{updatePage()}} method

h4. Expected Results
The {{storePage()}} triggers the creation of a new page and {{updatePage()}} triggers an update of a page with the version 2 of the page being created.

h4. Actual Results
The new page gets created, however, version 2 page is not being created, because the {{updatePage()}} method fails with the following error:

h4. Findings
The {{updatePage()}} will work only when the XML and DOCTYPE declarations are not present
fields.summary: updatePage() Remote API method does not allow XML or DOCTYPE declarations in the page's content property

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

1) Start a new page in Confluence
2) Enter a word
3) Highlight the word and click on the bold icon in the toolbar, the word should now be bolded
4) Now click at the end of the word to un-highlight it (ie to move the cursor to the end of the word) and press enter, you should now be on a newline
5) Click on the bullet icon in the toolbar, a bullet should now appear
6) We can not find anyway to now add text next to that bullet.
fields.summary: After creating a bulleted list, users can't enter text after the bullet
Ability to insert math formulas/equations in Confluence

fields.description:
An employee recently left our department (username bgarrett1) and now her name is rendering strangely in the Contributors Macro.  Whenever her name is supposed to appear it reproduces the name of the person preceding her instead.

I've attached a screenshot showing this behavior.  In this example we are using the macro twice, once to show contributors and again to show watchers.  On the first row, when you hover of the name of the first person the link is:
https://confluence.uwf.edu/display/~efridge

The second link (with the same exact name shown) says:
https://confluence.uwf.edu/display/~bgarrett1

This second link should say her name - Brianna Garrett.

Our users are synced into Confluence via an LDAP connection.  She is no longer listed as a user in the admin control panel, but I see her username in the "created by" at the top of the pages she has created.  Digging into the database, she still has an entry in the user_mapping table and her user_key is still all over the place in the CONTENT table.
fields.summary: Old users name not appearing in the Contributors Macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-30541].
  {panel}

h3.Proposal
Mainly it would be a feature to enable Pages to be searched even if they restricted.

h3.Current Scenario
Pages are hidden if the user has no Permissions
fields.summary: Allow Admin to enable Pages to be shown in Search from those who have not acces to it
Ticket status changed when updated

fields.description:
The search bar is not rendered correctly or displayed properly in IE8 (Internet Explorer 8). It is hardly visible if users are using white for the Look and Feel's color scheme on the Top bar.

The following is the screenshot taken from IE8
!s2.jpg!

The following is the screenshot taken from Firefox
!s1.png!

This has been tested on IE8, IE9 and Firefox. It is only reproducible on IE8, while IE9 and Firefox is working fine.
fields.summary: Search bar is not rendered correctly on IE8

fields.description:
For various reasons {{CONTENT_PERM}} table may contain permission settings for the same content, having different usernames. This is usually caused by having the username changed in an external user directory. This causes no problems during normal operation, only upon XML backup restore or for the newly introduced {{LowerCaseUsernameReferencesUpgradeTask}}, that seemingly converts all usernames in the {{CONTENT_PERM}} table to lowercase.

In such scenarios, this will cause the upgrade task to fail on unique constraint violation.

*Steps to reproduce*
# Synchronize an external user directory with Confluence 5.1.x with uppercase username, make sure to add a restriction on a page
# Change the username in the external directory to all lowercase, add the same restriction on the same page again
# Upgrade the instance to 5.2.3

*Workaround*
Identify the duplicate row by matching the lowercase values of the unique constraint on the {{CONTENT_PERM}} table and delete the record that has the uppercase username/groupname.

There is a problem with comments date after editing. Comment date is changed to a date... when it was edited!
This make a really headache, when you are fixing some typo in comment from a May 2013, and now it appear in the tree like a comment from 22 Aug 2013. So, all dialogue in comments is unclear (even if you are tracking comments with some changes in SVN or other instruments).

Two variants of fixing:
* Store original comment date and just show "- edited" suffix, like it working in JIRA 4.x
* Store original comment date and show "- edited at DD mmm YYYY"  suffix

But not change an original comment date to a date of comments editing! This is really annoying!
fields.summary: Store original date of comment and add last edit date to the comments, like in JIRA

fields.description:
I've noticed situations where someone edits a page and actually only modifies a targeted section of content, but the subsequent version comparison highlights what appeared to be a random set of paragraphs as having format changes. This originally annoyed me due to the increased noise when reviewing someone's changes, but later it got even more annoying when it caused merge conflicts when I was editing content in those sections where the other person's apparent random "format change" caused a merge conflict for me. When I view the two versions, I can't visually tell any difference between the sections that claim to have format changes. However, if I view the "storage format" for the two versions, I see that there is a case difference in the "line-height" style attribute. And I'm guessing that this is what is causing the comparison engine to assume a format change was done. Below are examples of the same Heading 2 line that was in the original page version's storage format, and then the one in the new version, where I am confident the editor of the new version didn't touch that section. *

Policy

*

Policy

If I search the storage format content, it seems that every place where a line-height style attribute was present, its case was changed. I haven't yet been able to confirm the browser and version that the editor was using, but I believe it would have been IE 9 or potentially IE 8. As a shot in the dark, I'm assuming the WYSIWYG editor you guys are using maybe introduced that casing toggle? And maybe you could post process the storage format to revert that casing toggle in those situations, assuming there isn't a way to fix it up stream? I attached the following images: * VersionComparisonHighlightingFormattingChanges.png shows the version comparison highlighting formatting differences, where there was no visible change * ComparisonOfStorageFormatShowingLine-HeightCaseChanges.png that shows the differences in the storage format that was just the casing of the line-height style attribute, as well as a lot of extract white space, but at least it seems your version comparison is tolerant of extra white space.
fields.summary: Editing a page can cause the "line-height" style's casing to change which triggers "format changes" in version comparison adding noise and increasing probability of merge conflicts for concurrent editing

Here are the steps to reproduce the issue: 
# Install a new Confluence instance.
# Add a new user directory with LDAP (or Active directory).
# Create a new user "testuser" on LDAP.
# Synchronized the user to Confluence. 
# Login with the new user and change the user setting like "Notify on my actions" for example.
# Logout and remove the user from the LDAP then perform the synchronization on Confluence again to remove the user. 
# Look into the table "os_propertyentry" of Confluence, the related user properties are still there.

The issue is not affecting any functionality of Confluence, but when upgrading from the version 5.1 to 5.2.3, it will show up the warning message in the log file:

2013-08-22 12:04:09,192 WARN [main] [atlassian.confluence.upgrade.UpgradeTask] matchUserKeysToUserProperties The following 1 usernames could not be matched for user property migration and will be ignored: [testuser]
{noformat}

  {panel}

Firefox 23 [now blocks mixed active content by default|http://blog.mozilla.org/security/2013/05/16/mixed-content-blocking-in-firefox-aurora/], so if an HTTP YouTube link is embedded using the Widget Connector in a Confluence instance that runs over HTTPS, the result is that the widget fails to appear at all. It looks like this when the page is loaded:
!ff23.png!

This improvement request is to add a placeholder image with a warning so that the user knows what is happening instead of simply seeing a blank space.

For users running into this issue, please see this KB for workarounds:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/Widget+Connector+not+Displaying+Embedded+Content+when+Using+Firefox+or+Chrome
fields.summary: Show placeholder and warning in Widget Connector if embedded material is blocked by browser due to mixed active content

fields.description:
Error occurred during template rendering: Invocation of method 'getLocale' in class com.atlassian.confluence.core.ConfluenceActionSupport threw exception java.lang.IllegalStateException: Spring Application context has not been set at /decorators/includes/header.vm[line 57, column 41]. Contact your administrator for assistance.

can you help?
fields.summary: Starting up confluencing error

fields.description:
We updated our Jira Macro to version 5.0.2
After this update, our existing filters are broken: Most columns are empty, it looks like now it makes a difference if big or small letters are used (e.g. Type vs. type). In the old filters, it looks like all columns are written with big letters.
How can this be changed? We can't edit every filter, this are too much.
fields.summary: Jira Macro update problem

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

1. Create a new Confluence page
2. Type "{panel"
3. Press <esc> to cancel the macro dialog (pretend you changed your mind about what macro you wanted to enter)
4. Press <Command-Shift-Left> to select the text to the beginning of the line
5. Type "{note".

Note that the macro selector dialog gets confused and it somehow incorporates the text that was previously selected (and which should have been deleted), meaning that the new macro is not selected correctly.

See the attached screencap for a demonstration.
fields.summary: Entering a macro name twice using keyboard shortcuts fails to insert macro

fields.description:
We updated our Confluence JIRA macro to 5.0.2 after our Confluence update to 5.2.3 (otherwise we had some errors).

Now we have the problem: When we use the Jira macro with a confluence profile language, that is not english, the macro delivers as result empty filters, but the preview still works.
The reason: It tries to use e.g. german column names, that Jira don't knows (see screenshots).
Result: Empty tables.
fields.summary: Jira Macro language problem

fields.description: In Confluence 5.1.3 the "create from template" macro created child pages from where the macro was used. This does not work anymore in version 5.1.5. New pages from the template are created directly below the the space home page. The behavior should be changed again to create child pages or to be more customizable specify the parent page for the new pages in the macro. Otherwise it is not possible to keep a clean space structure.
fields.summary: create-from-template macro creates pages in wrong place

fields.description:
I have an SMTP server configured through a JNDI resource in the server.xml. This worked in 5.1.5. After upgrading to 5.2.3, I keep getting an exception, see below.

Something that is also interesting, the activation.jar is NOT present in confluence/WEB-INF/lib, whereas it was in the previous versions. So I cannot move it! (see https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Configuring+a+Server+for+Outgoing+Mail at the bottom) 

I tried copying it from my OLD BACKED UP installation folder to confluence/lib, but this does not do the trick.

I verified, and the two jars (activation.jar and mail.jar) are not in <confluence-install>/confluence/WEB-INF/lib, but are in <confluence-lib>/lib  

This is the exception that occurs when trying to send a test-email:

fields.description:
When a macro is part of a user's selection in the editor, it should be more obvious that it has been selected.

These are the ways that a macro could become part of a user's selection in the editor:

- Click the header of the body macro placeholder,
- Click the "Select for Copy / Cut" option in the properties panel,
- Use the keyboard arrows + shift key to select a range of text, or
- Use the mouse to click and drag a range of text

The visual distinction between a macro that's selected in the editor can be quite vague across browsers.

Each browser (Chrome, IE, FF) does a decent enough job of inline placeholders. Because inline placeholders are images, the browser is familiar with how to place a selection indication over the top of them.

The browsers operate a bit differently for bodied macro placeholders:

* Chrome (OSX) highlights the entire body contents of the macro, including vertical padding (but not horizontal).
* Firefox (OSX) will apply a glowing outline to the inside of the bodied section of the macro placeholder. The glow is similar to that applied to form input fields.
* IE (7,8) provides no indication that the macro placeholder is selected. IE only highlights text characters in the editable region.
fields.summary: Make it more obvious when a macro placeholder is included in a text selection

fields.description:
First step in Confluence's setup wizard is to enter a license (/setup/setuplicense.action). This requires cutting the generated Server ID and pasting it onto the my.atlassian.com license page.

!conf_lic.png!

However the 'Server ID' input field has the attribute {{disabled="disabled"}}, which has the effect of making it unselectable (at least in latest Firefox). So one can't cut & paste it.

Rather than {{disabled}}, the element should have is a {{readonly}} attribute, which makes it selectable without being editable.
fields.summary: Cannot cut & paste Server ID field from Setup Wizard

fields.description:
Since updating to 5.1.5 of confluence I've encountered an error with the edit fuctions within IE 8.

When editing a table on a page and selecting the option to add another row, the row is added but a whitespace character is added to the start of every cell on that row. This means that the merge function will not work correctly until all whitespace is cleared from the row and any editing will be out of alignment.

Also when selecting the row for merge, copy or other function, the edit page seems to "jump" if the page is long so that the row you have selected moves to the bottom which can be quite annoying.

This happens in IE 8 on Win XP but not in Chrome or Firefox 23.0.
This also does not occur in IE 9, Chrome or FF on Windows 7 however we have quite a number of staff who need to remain on XP w/ IE 8 for legacy program compatibility.
fields.summary: IE 8 - extra whitespace in table cells, editing page "jumps" during edit operations

Fabien

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-30485].
  {panel}

I am experiencing this problem in Firefox, but not in Chrome or Safari.

When I have a heading that includes a question mark, the link to that heading from the Table of Contents macro does not work.

To reproduce:

1) Create a new page.
2) Insert some Heading 1s that include a question mark at the end.
3) Insert the Table of Contents macro somewhere on the page.
4) Save your change and view the page in a Firefox browser window.

Expected result: The TOC will list all the headings (up to the level that you specified in the macro). When you click on a heading, it will take you to that section of the page.

Actual result: The TOC lists all the headings correctly, but when you click on any of them, nothing happens.

I am writing a FAQ page. It is very hard to do that without including question marks in the headings! Help!!
fields.summary: (In Firefox browser) Links in Table of Contents Macro not working when heading includes a question mark
Comments should include "creation date"

fields.description:
*SYNOPSIS:*
If you have a page with a 'Table of Contents', any anchor links with a URL containing certain special characters will be broken. For example, if any of the following appear in a Header, the corresponding link in the Table-of-Contents will not work: ampersands, colons, commas, double-quotes, equal signs, forward-slashes, parentheses, single-quotes. 

Note that dashes in a header do not cause any problem.
I have not tested asterisks, at symbols, carets, curly braces, dollar signs, exclamation points, reater-than signs, less-than signs, percent signs, periods, plus signs, question marks, square brackets, underline aka underscore characters, verticle bars, nor single or double-byte foreign characters (e.g. the Euro or Yen sign).

*SNAPSHOT:* Please see [^AtlassianConfluenceSpecialCharsBug.png]

*ENVIRONMENT:* Firefox ESR 17.0.8 on a 64-bit Win 7 Professional

*WORK-AROUND:*
The work-around is easy enough-- remove the special characters.
fields.summary: special characters in a Header or Page-Title breaks corresponding 'Table of Contents' link
